title: Introducing narrator
text: Starting simplest table one dimension one measure. overall sales volume well outlying Territories analyzed. Total Sales across Territories 2.2 M. Outlying Territories Sales: NA (938,914.9, 42.2 %), EMEA (662,430.6, 29.8 %).
code: df_one <- sales %>%   group_by(Territory) %>%   summarise(Sales = sum(Sales, na.rm = TRUE)) %>%   arrange(desc(Sales))  kable(df_one) narrate_descriptive(df_one)

title: Introducing narrator
text: Total Sales across Territories 1.6 M. Outlying Territory Sales: NA (938,914.9, 58.6 %). NA, significant Product Sales: Product E (257,960.1, 27.5 %), Product B (181,285.7, 19.3 %), Product F (142,396.1, 15.2 %) Outlying Products Sales: Product E (447,272.2, 27.9 %), Product B (291,827.9, 18.2 %), Product F (225,460.4, 14.1 %).
code: df_two <- sales %>%   filter(Territory %in% c("NA", "EMEA")) %>%   group_by(Territory, Product) %>%   summarise(Sales = sum(Sales, na.rm = TRUE)) %>%   arrange(desc(Sales))  kable(df_two) narrate_descriptive(df_two)

title: Introducing narrator
text: Key argument narratives coverage. used narrate important things avoid simple looping dimension levels.  default coverage set 0.5 means narration stop soon cumulative sum reaches 50 % mark. increased coverage, additional narrative returned. Total Sales across Products 2.2 M. Outlying Products Sales: Product E (606,807, 27.3 %), Product B (415,404.5, 18.7 %), Product F (294,399, 13.2 %). Total Sales across Products 2.2 M. Outlying Products Sales: Product E (606,807, 27.3 %), Product B (415,404.5, 18.7 %), Product F (294,399, 13.2 %), Product (256,140.4, 11.5 %).
code: df_three <- sales %>%   group_by(Product) %>%   summarise(Sales = sum(Sales, na.rm = TRUE)) %>%   arrange(desc(Sales))  df_three %>%   mutate(Share = round(Sales/sum(Sales)*100, 1),          Cumulative = cumsum(Share)) %>%   kable() narrate_descriptive(df_three) narrate_descriptive(df_three, coverage = 0.7)

title: Introducing narrator
text: Template-based systems based calculations individual variables, combining together inside template. can return list calculated variables full narrative realization: Let’s change template narrative function rework wording well changing ‘’ ‘’ since Sales plural: Overall Sales Products equal 2.2 M. Outlying Products Sales: Product E (606,807, 27.3 %), Product B (415,404.5, 18.7 %), Product F (294,399, 13.2 %). can set templates using usethis::edit_r_environ() setting environment variable using data science platform capabilities. [1] “Total {measure} equal {total}.” Total Sales equal 2.2 M. Outlying Products Sales: Product E (606,807, 27.3 %), Product B (415,404.5, 18.7 %), Product F (294,399, 13.2 %). method little handy setting .Renviron variable names using certain convention adding use_renviron = TRUE narrate function. example created variable uses unique part function name, underscore, template name - descriptive + - + template_total Total Sales equal 2.2 M. Outlying Products Sales: Product E (606,807, 27.3 %), Product B (415,404.5, 18.7 %), Product F (294,399, 13.2 %). can get templates currently available package list_templates() function:
code: narrate_descriptive(df_three, coverage = 0.7, return_data = TRUE) #> $template_total #> Total Sales across all Products is 2.2 M.  #>  #> $narrative #> Total Sales across all Products is 2.2 M.  #> Outlying Products by Sales: Product E (606,807, 27.3 %), Product B (415,404.5, 18.7 %), Product F (294,399, 13.2 %), Product I (256,140.4, 11.5 %).  #>  #> $template_outlier_final #> Outlying Products by Sales: Product E (606,807, 27.3 %), Product B (415,404.5, 18.7 %), Product F (294,399, 13.2 %), Product I (256,140.4, 11.5 %).  #>  #> $measure #> [1] "Sales" #>  #> [[5]] #> [1] "Product" #>  #> $total #> [1] "2.2 M" #>  #> $outlier_insight #> [1] "Product E (606,807, 27.3 %), Product B (415,404.5, 18.7 %), Product F (294,399, 13.2 %), Product I (256,140.4, 11.5 %)" narrate_descriptive(   df_three,   template_total = "Overall {measure} for all {pluralize(dimension1)} are equal to {total}. ") Sys.getenv("descriptive_template_total") narrate_descriptive(   df_three,template_total = Sys.getenv("descriptive_template_total")   ) narrate_descriptive(df_three, use_renviron = TRUE) list_templates() %>%   kable()
